author: {'steamid': '76561198031412722', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1585486396}
review:
Helen's Mysterious Castle - классическая JRPG с довольно интересной боевой системой. Вместо управления командой из трех-четырех персонажей, под контролем игрока находится только один. При этом здесь нет обычных для игр жанра раундов, но есть временная шкала, продвижение по которой осуществляется после выбора используемого предмета.

Математически игра очень тонко проработана и на счету здесь каждая единичка атаки, защиты или скорости. Разнообразных соперников в игре не очень много, но каждый из них помимо набора различных атак имеет свой алгоритм поведения, что делает игру довольно детерминированной и нивелирует эффект удачи.

Сюжет не особо выделяется. Он в большой степени пародиен, но не опускается до абсурдности Disgaea. Раскрытию вселенной помогают отлично прописанные и запоминающиеся NPC.

Совокупно HMC - это отличная игра, из которой можно почерпнуть много интересных идей. Рекомендую всем любителям классических JRPG для ознакомления.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842507057', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1587993276}
review: 很有趣很可爱的一款小制作游戏，前期会觉得战斗很有意思，剧情基本为无；中后期战斗和地图偏难，快到结尾时才发现剧情原来这么温暖和可爱，有些舍不得那些被我刷过的怪物们。10小时两个结局+隐藏图通关，原本就不贵的游戏打折入的觉得很值，适合日式RPG爱好者

author: {'steamid': '76561198068134991', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1681877148}
review:
This game is a wolf in sheep's clothing. Made in RPG Maker, all of the game's graphics, music and sound use the absolute most default of its pack-in materials. However, it uses them to full effect with some nice layouts, dungeon design and a charming 16-bit aesthetic. Appearances can be deceiving though, and this game is very ingeniously made

This game is a dungeon-crawler at heart and combat is where the real meat of this game lies, by way of a novel and very clever turn-based battle system. The loop of exploring, battling, looting and progressing is rather addictive, and it owes to an ingenious timing-based mechanic. Each weapon, shield and spell has a timer assigned to it, and learning how to use the timer to your advantage is the key to success.

Overall, this game won't set the world on fire. But this battle system is one of the few examples of turn-based combat done thoughtfully, and done right. Snag this game and treat yourself to a short, vibrant dungeon crawl. It's well worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198399079728', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1576320082}
review:
4時間程度でエンディング。
無料版は未経験、他関連作もまったく知らずの状態でプレイ。

システム周りの話としては、戦闘はタイムカウントによる武器や魔法での殴り合い。各装備品には「威力・守備・特殊技能」という能力値と使用時間が設定されており、それを活用していく形。実際にプレイしてみると、そこまで考えなくてもいいがまったく考えずに戦うと負けるという「すこしだけ考える」の名が非常に適当なバランス感覚になっていました。すげえ。
ボスもちゃんと（実質的なレベル上げであるところの）武器強化をした上で戦闘中に対策を練りつつ殴っていく必要があるのも良質なRPGって感じで好印象。経験値稼ぎも対策さえできていれば楽々で良い。

で、肝心のシナリオですが、これはもうめちゃくちゃ良い。良すぎました。最高です。
ただラストあたりに関しては王道的かつ平凡だったので、最高だと言ったのはそこではない。最高だと感じた部分は、作品中盤にあるのです。

ふしぎの城を探索し、奥へ奥へと進んでいく中で主人公は「古き良きRPGのラスボス」たる存在を打倒する。町の住民は喜び、長はよくやったと微笑む。確かに強い敵だった。恐ろしい相手だった――
――故にこそ。お前はこの先に進むことが許される。
開ける道。暗い階段を抜けた先には、一面の「青空」――今まで見たことのなかった空という概念、すなわちそれは異界の風景。”遥かなるニライカナイ”へと物語は広がっていく――

この場面が、五回来て五回とも鳥肌立ちました。グラフィックと曲が噛み合いすぎて最高でした。ここまでキマってる演出はなかなか無いと思います。最高です。
真実に辿り着くことは正しいのか、誰かの選択は正解だったのか、目の前の相手に向かうのは何の為なのか。短いながらも楽しめた、名作でした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030706120', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1500987301}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050705369', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1585165548}
review:
До этого момента я не играл в подобного рода игры. Пошаговая боевка мне не нравилась, да и мало какие игры завлекают. Но тут мне попалась эта игра на глаза. Стоила не много, ну и решил купить. Однако эта игра оказалась той, которую я прошел от начала и до конца.
С начала игры вы просто ходите по данжам, убиваете монстров, качаете шмот. Но где-то с середины игры вам уже начинают рассказывать, что тут к чему. Сюжет не шибко замысловатый, но вполне себе. Понравилась боевка. У каждого предмета есть время на подготовку, что мне показалось интересным. Из-за этого к каждому врагу есть свой подход и можно делать свои сборки.
Музыка в игре потрасающая! Один OST в локации [spoiler]Sky Tower[/spoiler] чего стоит. Эта музыка застряла в моей голове!
А сама по себе игра лайтовая. На прохождение этой игры потратите часов 8-9. Особых сложностей в прохождений возникнуть не должно.
Стоимость у игры очень маленькая, а эмоций она может подарить не мало. Если вы до этого не играли в игры с пошаговой боевкой и вам не хочется заморачиваться, а просто расслабиться и поиграть, то покупать эту игру однозначно стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045785308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1584092014}
review:
So this is my first actual playthrough and completion of a RPGMaker game on Steam.

For 2 bucks, it wasn't bad. Started out fairly slow, but it started to develop some story along the way. The combat system, for as much as I despise turn-based combat, was honestly pretty refreshing. The use of a wait timer to help determine how fast or how slow one's attacks could be was a nice touch. In terms of story, there were some aspects added in that were pretty comedic - unexpectedly so, in fact, so when they did manage to turn up I was shocked and bemused.

All in all, fairly alright for asking price.

I also went around in circles many times trying to figure out the puzzles; sometimes driving me insane but with the hardships its a pretty awesome game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093133519', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1584858932}
review: O sistema de batalha é muito interessante, sendo baseado nos equipamentos que estamos usando, onde os pontos de experiência ganhos nas batalhas tornam-se "moedas" para evoluir cada arma. Apesar da história ser bem simples e com poucas falas, tem muitos bons clichês de rpg e animes clássicos, do tipo O inimigo final fica numa sala que para ser acessada devem ser derrotados seus mais poderosos generais. Um jogo de RPG Maker me surpreendeu muito positivamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207083779', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 853, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1580529097}
review: Wowowowowow!!! I got this game because of the name and I wanted to know the "mystery" as well... Expected a casual RPG, but got such a challenging and fun/interesting game.  The combat is different from the standard RPGs and even if you want to do some grinding: you are not bored at all!  There are enough animations / sounds and colors to keep you entertained.  Really liked the music/OST too.  Everything in the game is pleasant and fun and the story is surprising and got to find out that "mystery".  I would've loved to play a bunch of games with this particular style and story continuation!  Thank you for challenging me and amusing me for a while.  The game is MUCH appreciated!!! :D :D :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198010341798', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1579151251}
review: Helen's Mysterious Castle was a surprisingly pleasant experience. When i saw the price, i wasn't sure what to expect. I bought this year ago, and finally booted it up for the first time, and was certainly surprised! The world was beautifully made, I LOVED the pixelated style of everything. the music wasn't extraordinarily or grandiose, until the third boss! two chapters into the game, things went from good to fantastic! the writing was amazing, and reminded me of when games could have humor. It has a comedic charm, and takes itself seriously when it needs to. what i loved most was the gameplay, I LOVED THE COMBAT SYSTEM! It had a level of depth i never experienced before, and it was really enjoyable. I wouldn't mind a sequel, or another game from the same developers with this combat system. DEFINATELY give this game a try! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198120560745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1578693934}
review:
Helen's Mysterious Castle – это ретро рпг, которая встречает тебя милой пиксельной графикой, незамысловатой, но очень втемной музыкой, можно даже сказать, классической для игр подобного жанра.

Мы играем за девочку-эльфийку Хэлен, у которой так и чешутся руки (а вместе с ними и лук, и меч, и куча другого оружия) исследовать замок неподалеку. В подземельях замка нас встречают разномастные монстры, у каждого из которых определенный паттерн ведения боя и последовательности атак. Боевую систему вкратце можно описать так: сложность в простоте. Мы обладаем разными видами оружия, такими как луки, мечи, щиты, магия и всякие плюхи. Бой пошаговый, и каждое действие занимает время, т.е. система построена на правильном подборе оружия в нужный момент, однако ахтунг! - монстры могут ответить вам той же монетой. Этим система крайне занимательна: к мобам, конечно, быстро привыкаешь, как только просечешь их комбинации, а вот некоторые боссы могут заставить попыхтеть и потребовать особой тактики. При этом игра не суперсложная, это не хардкор рпэга для азиатских умов, а абсолютно проходимая игра для обывателя.

При всей интересности боевки, в игре также присутствует сюжет, который грамотно раскрывается по ходу повествования, и сопровождается таким количеством забавных и интересных диалогов, которого вот прям в самый раз. Не много, чтобы заскучать, но и не мало, чтобы сюжет был задвинут на заднюю полку и иногда лишь грустно выглядывал оттуда. Как уже сказали ораторы до меня, почти с самого начала витает ощущение, что что-то не так, и чем дальше проходишь, тем больше ты такой «а я чуял, я знааааал».

У меня прохождение заняло 10 часов, но уверена, игру можно пройти и быстрее, если не искать проходы ко всем потайным комнаткам и не болтать с каждым персонажем на локации в ожидании смешного ответа. Но, с другой стороны, в этом сок. :) 
По итогу, Helen's Mysterious Castle для меня – это игра, от которой я при первом запуске не ожидала многого, но осталась крайне довольна. Игра стоит дешевле чашки кофе/пачки сигарет, поэтому искренне рекомендую отказаться разок от вышеуказанного на выбор и добавить ее к себе в библиотеку. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198286561617', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1620745342}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091116148', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1627318143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198820002042', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1647110585}
review:
По началу игра не кажется какой-то особенной и вовсе мутной. Но после прохождения половинной части игры, сюжет начинает себя раскрывать с очень интересной и необычной стороны. Боевка пошаговая, предметы не сильно не обычные, особенного чего искать не стоит, но игра очень интересная своей динамичностью и сюжетом.
[spoiler] А еще можно играть за боссов в конце игры!
[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198180222819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1577092678}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040306735', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1576439720}
review: Does not have a modern interface, gameplay is very linear and the story is near non existent providing little motivation to go through the castle. Combat is interesting. The player calculates timing of enemy attacks and chooses the best response.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033624545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1575704699}
review: Quite the hidden gem with an awesome story, combat, and soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373439054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 14523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1635780505}
review:
短い時間でサクッと遊べるいいゲームでした。ストーリー、キャラクター、戦闘、世界観、BGM、動くドット絵、そのどれもが素晴らしく、プレイ後の満足感がすごいです。特に終盤の盛り上がりがヤバい！
しかし、悪い点として中盤以降の武器バランスが残念な感じでした。特定の武器が強すぎる...

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1574928137}
review:
Helen's Mysterious Castle can be a fun game but be warned it can get hard with some enemies able to remove 40-70% of your hp in 1 hit. the fights can also feel a little tedious at times since all fights are 1-1 and if you don't plan out moves you'll be dead fast (you'll wake up in your bed with all your stuff). thankfully inventory will not be much of a issue as there are only about 30 items. you can only hold 8 at a time but any item you drop will be picked up and stashed in some guys house for you to grab again anytime later (with levels). the story is fairly strait forward but gives you little to no hints on some of the parts. it's not often but when they happen they will stop you cold. overall i had fun but it does have a few issues.

gameplay
gameplay looks like a dragon quest/final fantasy battle but there is alot more going on. there are 3 main things you need to watch speed, defense, and attack. attack and defense work together like one would think. attack is how much hp you remove and defense will lessen that damage. EX: your sword has 10A but the opponent uses a shield with 6D so you remove 4HP but magic will ignore defense so keep that in mind. one last thing to note is defense moves raise your defense for the duration of the move. now for speed: each attack takes x time to perform x=speed. you will not know the first move an enemy makes but this can be a good thing as it means you go first. say if they are doing a 5S move and you do a 5S move you will do your move and still get to pick your next move before they do theirs.
Levels: you do get xp though you do not level instead you level your items. each item (but 1 that is double forged only) can level to 9 but after that can be reforged it by going to the blacksmith (you must kill 15 enemies after each forge) or by you if you eat a steak after you have 100HP (this lets you forge for 99xp).
NO new game+

author: {'steamid': '76561198273438059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1684803481}
review: Really fun little RPG with a unique combat system

author: {'steamid': '76561198187496702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1572550876}
review: A semi-roguelike exploration rpg that uses a timing system for duel-based battles. In this case, you can use XP dropped by monsters to upgrade your weapons and make earlier battles easier and later battles possible. (This is another game in the category of "Neat things you can do with RPG Maker.") The plot is left very nebulous, as Helen says nothing and apparently can’t read, so why you’re exploring the local ruins and fighting monsters is unclear at first. As you play, what seems like a standard exploration quest turns into a mindscrew--and I'm not going to spoil it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242748456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1532232469}
review:
看起来我只打了30分钟，实际上我搞不懂怎么装汉化补丁，干脆打汉化盗版打通关了。
这个游戏，从剧情上来说，是一个温馨的故事，背景规模并不宏达，但很多人物都刻画的非常鲜明，虽说结局让我蛮摸不着头脑的。
游戏性上来讲，中规中矩，有克制，有卡攻击时间，并不极端困难，但也有点挑战性，在战斗失败后会直接从房间里爬起来继续战斗。
战斗界面的人物动作吟唱演出做的非常棒，虽然是画面简陋的RPG小游戏，但动作展开流畅却做的很不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198110845601', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1573766773}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095146948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1573035244}
review:
Un juego muy entretenido con un sistema de batalla interesante y buena banda sonora, la historia es sencilla y el juego corto con una curva de dificultad muy buena.
Me divertí mucho jugandolo y por lo que vale se lo recomendaría a cualquiera que quiera pasar un buen rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981260160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1573012650}
review: Die-hard JRPG (and RPG Maker) and Roguelike fans might get a kick out of this, but I otherwise don't recommend it, despite its charm, visual design and music. Story and direction are minimal and the gameplay is frustrating and repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049854944', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1573319948}
review:
Simples e adorável, pra quem é fã dos modelos de rpg de antigamente é bom experimentar esse,
pode ser bem confuso no início mas depois que pegar o jeito você fica curioso pelo final que parece nunca chegar

author: {'steamid': '76561198055355746', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1535614066}
review:
This game is super interesting: it takes default assets from an old version of RPGmaker, and makes something unique out of it. 

Most of the sprites are touched up, the music is remixed, the battle system is an original spin on standard turn-based RPG combat, and it's wrapped up in a memorable story with some surprisingly likable characters. 

Also it's funny.

If you like RPGmaker games and wanna play a pretty special one, I definitely reccomend Helen's Mysterious Castle.

review:

不要被这游戏不明所以的开头骗了——女主不会读写说而已，并不是制作组偷懒没写告示牌和对话。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071166106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1565479935}
review:
In my musings and wayward searches for a quality RPG on Steam, happenstance found me upon this page, snickering at the notion of anyone paying for a game made in RPG Maker. Why would anyone pay for something so generic? But, seeing as it was $2, a pittance of a lunch meal's expense, I laughed and thought, "why not? This should be a good joke."

And so it was. At least, at first, it seemed that way. The game starts off as innocuously as possible, and with poor translation and obscure controls (arrow keys, Shift to run, Z and X buttons), I couldn't help but think I had been swindled. But I figured, let's see how far the ruse goes.

?

Oh yes, it was in fact a ruse - a grand one, indeed. For by the time you play your first few battles, one quickly gets swept away by the combat system and its simple intricacies, and you find yourself as puzzled as you are enriched. 

It takes time for the game to develop beyond its humble beginning, but the plot builds, the gameplay develops, the music grows, and the true majesty of the very best $2 you ever spent on Steam becomes obvious.

I will spoil no more. Enter the Mysterious Castle, discover your delight at the clever game mechanics, and enjoy being carried away by the whimsical story, all easily accomplished within a weekend of play.

Count yourself among the lucky few to find this precious pearl. 

!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128730998', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2209, 'last_played': 1584220071}
review:
このゲームはシミュレーションRPG好きならきっと楽しめると思います。
1対1の戦闘しかありませんが、その戦闘システムは非常に美しく、
そのシステムを多様に生かしたいろいろな敵をいろいろな方法で倒す楽しみがあります。
めちゃくちゃボリュームがあるわけではないのですが(値段に比べたらめちゃくちゃありますが)、
いろいろな縛りプレイなどに挑戦するなど、凝り始めるとフルパッケージのソフトもびっくりな時間遊ぶことができます。

もともとこのゲームは、無料版が存在するはずなので、ネットを探せば今でも手に入るかもしれません。
面白いか確認できないと買えない方はそれを探してやってみてからでもよいかもしれません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198201453049', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1568952214}
review:
Wonderful game, I love everything about it.

I don't really have anything to criticize, so I'll list the things that struck me the most.

- The battle system is amazing and so much fun. 1vs1 fights on which you have to really plan your moves. During your travel through the castle you get a LOT of weapons and some passive equipment, you can only have up to 8 at a time on Helen, but there is a zone with a guy that keeps everything you have picked before, so you can switch them without a problem. 

The EXP you get from defeating enemies goes to lvling your weapons and not the character, which only gets more HP mostly by advancing the story. Anyway, this gives a lot of room to try new tactics or even self imposed challenges, though I think most people will end up using similar equipment, once you get the hang of it, it's easy to know what are the best of a certain type. 

- I quite liked the story, you start without knowing anything, Helen doesn't even talk haha. Thanks to the meetings with the others and your own actions you will understand what's going on. All the main characters are truly charming.

- Finally the music, I possibly liked every tune, and it complemented perfectly the above points. Made boss battles thrilling, some story moments touching and even exploring areas fun.


Keep in mind that it's a short game, the last save of my first playtrough says 5h 23m, and that's without all the reloading, I simply refused to lose and spawn with a delicious steak. 

On my second, which I played after finishing another game, it says 3h 29m, and this time I tackled the extra dungeon, it was very good btw, seriously, what a twist.

In any case, I'm left quite satisfied, I could totally play it again by my own rules and make it more difficult just for the fun of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333429246', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1561257193}
review:
I debated on whether or not I really wanted to buy this game for a while before I finally decided to buy it, and I'm grateful that I did because I loved this game! You know that feeling when you're at work and you really want to do something back home so you keep thinking about that thing until work time is over and you sprint home to do it? That thing was [b][i]Helen's Mysterious Castle[/i][/b] for me.

The adventure begins with Helen, a character who can't read and only says "!" or "?", who runs off into the Northern Ruins despite her brother saying it's dangerous and to beware of the ruins. Story starts off simple enough but there are many surprises awaiting as the adventure continues. The game itself is very short but the story is engaging and enjoyable.

The gameplay is interesting and will have you pondering over the actions you choose to take in hopes of achieving the best outcome. Basically, there's a wait bar for both the player's turn and the enemy's turn and each ability has a number of turns to wait on before the ability can be unleashed. If you use an attack that waits on 13 turns and the enemy uses an attack that only waits on 5 turns then the enemy will be able to attack you first and again if they choose to repeat that action, same vice versa. Some of the strongest or most useful abilities require a lot of waits so its best to plan out your actions beforehand. It may sound a little complex but it's really easy to get the hang of when playing, and it's fun to switch out different weapons and abilities to defend, attack, and become an unstoppable force.

I actually didn't think much on the art or characters before I bought the game, but I grew to appreciate them more as the game proceeded. The characters are fun to talk to and made me laugh a lot. The music was also enjoyable for what it was and fitted the mood of some scenes very well, like the scenes with the brother. Honestly, I can see myself listening to some tracks for relaxation sometimes.

I didn't find any problems with the game really and had fun traversing the world with Helen [spoiler](I liked seeing Ahriman being used in the bonus dungeon as I was studying some Zoroastrianism around the time I was playing this game)[/spoiler]. For only $1.99, [b][i]Helen's Mysterious Castle[/i][/b] is definitely worth the purchase and I hope others find the game as amusing as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034228759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1561307089}
review: Very nice and original combat mechanics, great music and even the story is not half bad. The following is a poor comparison, because the games don't have much in common besides good music and being retro RPGs, but I myself found this way better than Undertale. Also, it's as cheap as it gets for a non-freemium game. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116667209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1561925298}
review:
This game is highly enjoyable, the music is great and the art and characters have a nostalgic charm to them. Considering its price point I recommend this to everybody.

The game's story is subtle in the first few hours of the game and mostly driven on humor and curiosity, but by the end it is fairly charming and enjoyable.

The art is a very well crafted and unique 8-bit style.

The score was a wonderful experience reminiscent of Falcon music, it was a joy throughout the entirety of the game.

Overall, I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084869225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1652465828}
review:
A rare gem that I almost completely missed. Don't be put off by the standard RPG Maker assets, this game uses them to great effect and makes them its own, and there's so much more to it.
The combat system is fantastically balanced, strategic, and unique; it starts as a simple puzzle for each monster and grows into a crazy dance-like exchange between you and the enemy, with both of you planning around and countering each other's every move.
For years I've thought that it was impossible to make turn-based RPG mechanics work with only one party member, but this game proved me wrong and then some.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058545947', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1492952371}
review: This is a game that REALLY takes advantage of RPGMaker to make something completely original. The battle system is something I've never come across before but at the same time feels completely intuitive. The story is interesting, the characters are fun, and the combat is engaging. You really can't ask for anything more from this type of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025767241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1634064957}
review: This game is incredibly charming. The cast is overwhelmingly charming, and so are the enemies... and yet, the combat system made me think more of a puzzle game than anything else. That's not a mark against it. It's wonderful, and to think that the lead character's appearance comes from one of the RPG Maker default assets...

author: {'steamid': '76561198089196637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1558219770}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062265037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1557022268}
review:
I have no idea why the reviews are so high for this. Are people going really easy on it because of the price? For me, this is a very cheap game and plays like it. It doesn't even have a tutorial or any kind of introduction to the story. The combat, overworld and controls all feel clumsy. There's nothing that appeals to me about this game at all.

I mean I know it doesn't cost much, but there's still an investment of time as a player here. I can't justify using my time on this as opposed to a more in-depth, smooth, and professionally made RPG. Skip this title and save your money until you can afford something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859969196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1546643935}

author: {'steamid': '76561198274162127', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1557568794}
review: 超经典的rpg游戏，有动听的音乐，出乎意料又温馨的剧情，战斗系统的丰富程度和流畅度超出同类 RPG mark 游戏一大截，当然还有萌萌的女主角，虽然前期一直文盲，字都不认识，而且全程只用？！来跟别人交流，导致整体交互比较少，有些残念，不知道为什么给个这样的设定，npc是能听懂，但是我看不懂啊...＞︿＜，不会是懒得设定主角的台词吧🤣。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1580454661}
review: 1000/10 probably the most fun old school jrpg game i'll ever enjoy especially for that price woo glorious loved everything about this got lost at some parts but didnt piss me off in the slightest unlike so many other titles this one was just great all over cant say anything bad about it did everything without wanting to KMS 100% completion baby :D them plot twists though even if their kinda obvious gotta love them anyways so good now im only sad i'll never be able to play it again cause i dont do replays XD especially when i still remember all the story also some fights i dont wanna do again mfing secret dungeon ergh wonder how other people did some fights especially that one lol then again wasnt that bad but like my god so satisfying though god i love this game lol anybody that doesnt have it likes rpgs and got spare change get this thing wont regret it and if you dont like this jewel of a game i dont know whats wrong with you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170671818', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1682013531}
review:
I don't remember exactly how I stumbled across this game. It might've been during the JRPG kick I went on after playing Trails in the Sky. I was intrigued by the title, being a consummate D&D player, and the idea of exploring a mysterious castle piqued my curiosity, as well as did the unusual connotations (by lack thereof) of the titular mononym, Helen. Is she a witch? A ruler? An adventurer? The name itself gave few clues. I clicked on it and read the synopsis and top reviews. Huh. Seems kinda cool. Then I watched the video. Memories in me stirred, and I got a feeling that was something like kneeling down to uncover something noticed half-buried in the sand on a windy beach, and discovering what you've found may be more than what you expected. It was very cheap, so I purchased it with little hesitation. As I began playing, a rush of nostalgia flooded me with the memories of playing Link's Awakening on my Game Boy Original, squeezing in those last few precious minutes before bedtime, agonizing over exactly what the hell I was supposed to do with that fishing hook. It was a lot like the feeling of getting out of school and running home with fingers crossed that I wouldn't miss the newest episode of Pokemon, getting there just in time to catch the opening theme song. There was a magic in these moments that's extremely difficult to recapture, even just for fleeting moments. But for me, that's what this game does. The music is fantastic; the backdrops, evocative (a personal favorite of mine is when the sun begins to set on the castle).  

  Also it has, along with Trails in the Sky, my favorite combat system out of any JRPG I've ever played. Each weapon has a certain amount of time or "wait" associated with it. You know what attack the enemy is going to use and how much wait there is left until his attack. Say the enemy uses an attack with 15 ticks. You have time for 3 shots of your bow or one swing of your sword, or you could use your shield for 20 ticks and start again 5 ticks into his next attack, on the chance that he may use a slower one, giving you more time to charge up a longer (and more powerful) attack.

  The storyline is minimalist, with very little dialogue (the main character is mute), but the dialogue that's there is peppered with light-hearted humor, striking a balance between drama and comedy. 

All-in-all, this is one of the games I find myself revisiting every now and again, just to hear the music and bask in the ambience of days gone by. It's not a long game and is perfect for relaxing on a Sunday afternoon. I'm always on the lookout for more games like this, and I've found a few, but this is one of my favorites. Like that sparkle in the sand that catches your eye on that windy beach, a true hidden gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1551239776}
review:
Pretty great RPG for its price point. The main draw is the very good combat system. It's fairly unique and makes for fun and exciting battles, which are helped by creative boss gimmicks and varied enemy movesets. The character growth system is also pretty neat, letting you upgrade specific moves (offensive or defensive) instead of direct character buffs.

Other aspects are nothing special--level design, visuals/music, and story. It's also quite easy to get lost and not know the way forward at several points.

Overall, for the price of $2 this is worth checking out just for its combat system..

author: {'steamid': '76561198042605243', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1569697275}
review:
The only sin this game has is not being longer.
The combat mechanics are so intuitive, making you juggle between "Do I spam my shield defensively, or YOLO for that chance of victory?"

Well, another gripe I had was longsword was just flatout useless and worthless once you get the mythril blade, but you can work around this by using the longsword anyway as a way to challenge yourself. The only real limitations to RPGs are our imaginations after all.

The story is cute, and has some neat twists and turns. Simple and easy to follow, but adrenaline pumping all the same.

The really fun battles are the bosses, if you use some brainpower you don't even necessarily *have* to grind. And the secret dungeon...............
40/10 secret boss.

Also the music is really badass for being mostly MIDIs. Somebody should remix this soundtrack or something.

ANYWAY, arrivaderci.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356144403', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1548335028}
review:
非常推荐这款游戏，此作的剧情对于玩惯各类大作的套路剧情的我来说小有惊喜，在游戏的系统上的创新也非常有趣。
我个人对此作的评分是9.5/10
读档只能重新开始游戏略微有些不爽。
起初我原本以为只是一个爬塔游戏，不过有趣的操作系统加上我本人对回合制玩法的钟爱让我继续玩了下去。没想到后面的剧情各种转折，[spoiler] 难怪死亡后会回到床上，原来这是大家的大小姐啊，晕过去之后就哼哧哼哧的背回来了吧[/spoiler]在音乐和画面上的表现也很不错，几块钱的游戏有这么多音乐让我有点不敢相信。
[spoiler] 不过最后的迷宫在哪啊，我完全找不到[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198112360415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1548429299}
review:
jrpg의 정통 전투 방식이래서 사실 별 기대는 안했는데, 한글판으로 5분 해보고 빠져들어서 한글판 삭제후 바로 사버렸습니다.방식은 jrpg가 맞지만 특유의 대기시간(행동까지, wait) 덕분에 주관적으로 나름 손맛이 있습니다. 

안정적으로 운용하시는 분들은 초반에 골렘에게 딜이 안 박히면 활을 9강까지 강화하세요. 아직 잘 모르겠는데 렙업을 위한 경험치가 많이 필요한가 봐요.

적과 내 무기의 대기시간이 같고 내 턴이면, 선빵을 치고 가진 방패로 막아 데미지를 어느 정도 무효화 가능합니다. 반면 적은 시간이 없는데 내 턴이면 먼저 칠 수 있을 거 같지만, 적이 먼저 날 때리죠. (스크린샷만 보고 오해할까봐 적는건데 공격을 하든 방패로 막든, 대기시간은 불과 0.1~0.2초만에 떨어집니다)

저처럼 초반에 안정적으로 운용하는 분은 스켈과 싸울 때 난항을 겪으실 거에요. 그 전투방식을 보며 마치 검투사들의 결투 같다고 생각했습니다. 

내가 공격하면 적이 물러나고, 적이 공격하면 내가 다가가는 식으로. 죽지 않을 정도의 뎀지를 몸으로 받아내며 공격횟수를 늘려야 하는데, 상대방이 견제하듯이 쫒아오죠. 하지만 4개 종류의 무기에 상성이 있듯이, 적의 공격을 막아내며 빈틈을 노리는 전술도 있는 법입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432469570', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1542279004}
review: 相当相当相当优秀的小型rpg游戏，值得一玩，

author: {'steamid': '76561198057397015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1547500385}
review:
So I picked this game up when it was on sale for about a dollar. I was expecting a short but fun little game that would be ultimately forgettable. However, It ended up being one of the most fun RPGs I've ever played.

Usually I'm more interested in RPGs with long and interesting stories, and while this game did end up having a pretty interesting story, with a few laughs, it's really minimal compared to other RPGs, and is practically absent for the first half of the game. However, the appeal of Helen's Mysterious Castle comes from it's unique combat system that seems simple at first but reveals itself to be interesting and complex as it requires you to constantly be thinking about your next move and paying attention to what the enemy is doing.

I was going to explain how it works in depth, but really, this game is cheap, short, and easy to learn, so if you're a fan of turn based RPGs, then I recommend picking it up. At worst, you'll be pleasantly surprsied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122409817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1537788991}
review:
RPGツクールシリーズでの名作
個人的にレビューを読まずにやったほうがいいです



























--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
物語に完全に引き込まれました。
最初はダンジョンクリア型のゲームかと思い放置していたが、
少し遊んでみたら会話が所々に出てきて、進むにつれて???となっていった。

こういうストーリーもありだと思うし、
この作品以外でこういった内容で楽しめたストーリーは2023年現在でも知らないかも



ゲームシステムは少し変わっており多少なり頭を使いますが、
誰でも楽しめるシステムだとは思います。
難易度も優しめですが、基本ハードモードにして遊ぶ自分でも楽しく感じました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198859098173', 'num_games_owned': 10308, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1546103295}
review:
Helen knows little about who she is and where she is, but she's dying to find out. Stuck on a floating island 
with a maze-like castle begging to be explored, Helen lets her curiosity get the better of her. 
It's a good thing she's more than capable.

Armed with a plethora of weapons she finds on her journey, Helen must battle monsters, collect 
new equipment, and uncover the secrets of her mysterious home.
____________________________________________________________________________

Helen spends the game fighting on her own, and she wouldn't have it any other way. 
Using the unique 1-on-1 combat system, Helen can collect weapons, and 
switch between them during battle as the situation dictates. 

Using the passage of time and a knowledge of your opponents, you can quickly bring 
out the right weapon for the job and finish off foes before they have a chance to react.

Upgrade weapons using experience points gathered from defeated enemies, collect new 
weapons hidden within the labyrinth, and build the perfect arsenal.

Equip and upgrade weapons of all shapes and sizes, from bows and shields to broadswords 
and devastating magic spells. Learning when to use each weapon is the ultimate key to victory.
_______________________________________________________________________________

"Quote from the Developer" :o

''
This indie game was designed to make you think, just a little bit. Players have to figure out the answers for themselves, but the game isn’t meant to be overly complex. Anyone who’s tired of either games that are simply too complicated or conversely having their hand being held throughout the game might have something to take away from this title. Because this indie game was originally made so most people could play through it without too much trouble, I’ve added a trickier bonus dungeon for those playing the English version, who I assume will be more ‘core’ in what they’re looking for. And if that isn’t enough, there’s one more interesting surprise waiting for you... 

This game is made so that pretty much anyone can play through it, but I’ve added a trickier bonus dungeon for those playing the English version, whom I assume will be more core players. And if even that isn’t enough for you, there’s one more interesting surprise...
'' ~Satsu

I only can recommend this neat game. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197968410047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1546121782}
review: When you first start up Helen's Mysterious Castle, you'd be forgiven for thinking it's another garbage RPG Maker throwaway basd on the menu and first 10 minutes. You'd also be wrong! Starting out very simple with no narrative, it quickly evolves into a much more complex combat system as well as exploring the world you've found yourself in. Definitely worth the money and time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003479630', 'num_games_owned': 3936, 'num_reviews': 543, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1545419798}
review:
[h1]In Short: Interesting Combat, Fun Story, Charming Characters and a VERY low price point make this a must buy for any RPG Fan[/h1]

https://youtu.be/WcKh-6N6e2U
https://youtu.be/8kHR9LimcPw

It's not often you get to play as mute, illiterate elf in a game, but damn if this game doesn't make it FUN. In Helen's Mysterious Castle you play, well, Helen. an elven girl who disobeys her brother and goes directly into the ruins she was specifically told [b]NOT[/b] to go into.

And...that's pretty much the story. Ok, ok, there's a more to it, but the game has no intro; a rarity for RPG Maker games of [i]any[/i] calibur, but it’s also somewhat refreshing. It leaves it on the player to do the exploration and discovery. Another odd choice is that the developer chose to make nearly everything unreadable because...well...Helen can’t [i]read[/i].

This changes later on in the game, and I’m not sure if it was done intentionally to encourage backtracking for secrets and the like, but when I streamed it, we all found it hilarious that a mute elf who couldn’t read was breaking into monster’s homes, killing them for loot, and leaving their children orphaned.

A very unique (and wonderful) thing about the game is the combat. Deceptively simple, it relies on power, defense, and wait times to make your attacks effective. Just...be prepared to do a lot of math. If your attack takes longer than an enemy, they obviously will strike first. If your defense is more than their attack, you take no damage, and vice versa. If you both time it so you would attack at the same time, the game thankfully defaults to the player in every [b]tie[/b]. So be sure to time your attacks well.

While I love the game, there was one annoying aspect I was [b][i]not[/i][/b] a fan of: the leveling system. Instead of XP being used to level your character, you use it to level [i]items[/i]. That’s all fine and dandy, but the only way to increase your health is to...well...die. There are health increasing items you can find, but for any substantial gains you need to die. A lot. To me that feels like counter-intuitive gameplay.

+Wonderful, Unique Combat System
+Excellent story that unfolds at a good pace as you play
+Being illiterate can be fun!

=No clue what enemies will start off with in combat
=Combat can get grindy with lots of blocking
=No intro

-No 'Leveling'. XP is used to beef up items
-Easy to get locked into a certain strat, no matter what you're facing.

All that said, [b]BUY THIS GAME[/b]. It’s very well done, and was not at all what I expected when I bought and fired it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401179844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1545864107}
review:
Compré este juego sin muchas espectativas. Simplemente vi que estaba y como querìa esperimentar a jugar un RPG de este estilo, lo compré. No me imaginaba que iba a ser tan bueno. Definitivamente quiero probar màs del género y sin duda quiero una secuela. 

El lo que respecta ala jugabilidad es bastante sencilla. Solo controlas a un personaje y no hay demasiados elementos que compliquen el combate. Solo con tres parametros consigue crear un combate fluido pero a la vez simple sin llegar a aburrir. A eso debe sumarse que los combates no son aleatorios por lo que es muy raro entrar en batallas indeseadas y contando con que el juego tomarà unas 10 horas si es que te lo tomas con calma y descubres todos los secretos, no te da tiempo de aburrirte.

En lo narrativo mi  única queja es el uso de la amnesia el pricipio de la historia. Pero aunque al principio de la impresiòn de que no tiene historia en realidad esta misma es bastante interesante y logra construirse en un entorno muy reducido pero aprovecha al maximo el poco tiempo del que dispone para construir los personajes y el pequeño mundo en el que trascurre. Sin duda uno llega a sentir empatìa con los personajes al final de la historia.

Vale totalemnte la pena por el bajo precio que tiene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317964524', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1544784305}
review:
被英译标题坑了！一直用《海伦娜的神秘城堡》这个译名找攻略这些结果什么都找不到。
看了下面的评测才发现应该是《ふしぎの城のヘレン》（不可思议之城的海伦）。
幸好社区有指南，不然我就凉凉了。

一开始不熟悉游戏觉得战斗好难，等战斗多了掌握规律之后特别有成就感（一定要记得升级装备啊！是不是只有我打狮鹫的时候卡关卡到要死了才发现原来装备可以升级（泣）（当时做了好多计算，发现现阶段的血量和装备基本上没希望过狮鹫才发现有哪里不对）
helen真的好可爱的一只小天使~爱她。
特别喜欢通关前庆典的部分，去迷宫和怪物聊天的时候，有只幽灵跟我道歉，说它当时什么都不知道，它还以为我是坏蛋呢。笑。
治愈了我复变考试前支离破碎的心。

呃为什么我写测评总是那么多废话还没重点……
总之推荐！！！
打折的时候只要六块啊怎么可以不买！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198025697128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1619733517}
review:
虽然首发就入了，但拖延到今天才打。

从某种意义上而言，和我今年最喜欢的游戏之一的 Fortune-499 很相似，有一个挺 neat 的系统，点到好处不过多扩展，有着不宏大、不复杂又能让你会心一笑的情节，从各处都能体会到小作者的辛劳与爱。是那种让我稍微有点想做游戏的游戏。

其中回合轮次系统我没有在别处见过，不知是否有先例。一种近似于 ATB 与 AP 结合的系统，但时间不是被动的因素，打架在于从敌人身上依据自身装备找有效输出 loop。敌人同样也会这么做。很有趣味。虽然这个系统的延展性不佳，但在这个精巧短小的框架下恰到好处，不让人厌烦。同样与 499 有些相似的地方是，战斗因此比起 RPG 更像解谜。也是据此，我第一次觉得加法运算攻防伤害不是纯粹弱智。

4-6 小时长，非常便宜，十分推荐。

顺便汉化：https://bbs.saraba1st.com/2b/thread-1355794-1-1.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1538678149}
review:
[b]Helens Mysterious Castle[/b] ist ein klassisches RPG, dessen Kampfsystem auf dem Kampf 1vs1 basiert.
Eine Zusammenfassung gibt es wie immer unten :D

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Die [b]Dungeons[/b] sind an die klassischen RPGs wie beispielsweise Lufia2 angelehnt. Folglich gibt es in Dungeons allerlei Geheimnisse zu entdecken und Rätsel zu lösen. Nicht selten kommt man erst durch einen Geheimgang wirklich weiter oder muss ein Rätsel lösen. Auch Schätze gibt es allei zu finden. Meist sind dies Waffen, die man bis zu zehn Mal upgraden kann.

[b]Die Heldin kann nicht im Level aufsteigen oder eigenständig Skills lernen wie in RPGs üblich.[/b] Daher hängen ihre Kampffertigkeiten völlig von den [b]bis zu acht Items[/b] ab, die man überall finden kann. Wenn man bereits acht hat und ein anderes findet, muss man ein getragenes wegwerfen. Dieses kann man dann in einem speziellen Raum wieder aufnehmen. Seinen Level behält das Item hierbei. 
Wie bereits erwähnt können diese Aufgelevelt werden. Das erfolgt durch die gewonnene Erfahrung aus Kämpfen. 
Hierdurch erhöht sich entweder der deffensivwert von Waffen oder Schilden oder es verringert sich die Wartezeit bis zum Einsatz. Das hängt vom Item ab, das man aufwertet.

Sollte man ein Mal einen Kampf verlieren, heißt es nicht direkt Game Over. Man landet entweder im Bett bei sich daheim oder im INN und kann auf dem Weg zum Neuversuch noch ein Paar EXP sammeln.

[h1]Soundtrack,Grafik[/h1]
Der Soundtrack ist durchweg hörenswert und passt zum Spiel.
Die Grafik ist im Stil des RTP des RM2k gehalten. Allerdings wurden viele Elemente nachträglich hinzugefügt, ohne dass diese einen Stilbruch auslösen. 

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]
[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Kämpfe mit taktischem Tiefgang
    [*]Dungeons sind durchweg gelungen
    [*]Klasse Optik und Soundtrack
    [*]kein wirkliches Game Over nach Niederlage
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Das Steak, das man bei einer Niederlage bekommt und das die maximalen HP steigern soll, funktioniert nicht richtig.
    [*]Story etwas schwach
[/list]

[b]Fazit[/b]
Helens Mysterious Castle ist ein Spiel, das sich an Fans klassischer RPGs richtet, ohne grafisch schwach zu sein.
Das Gameplay ist generell recht frustfrei gehalten, ohne dass die Kämpfe zu lasch wirken.
Wer sich von der RTP Optik nicht abschrecken lässt, findet hier eine echte Perle von Spiel und das für lausige 1.99€.
Von mir daher eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233851776', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 69, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1711946892}
review:
Untitled, so Have a Steak! (lol)

(Yes, that's an odd thing to me to have the title of the game in the window be 'Untitled', but just a little thing I find funny.)

Overall, this is a great game, and not a bad buy at full price, even better at a discount (I got it at 40% off). There are issues many that make this game one I'd not recommend to everyone, but to the RPG veterans that are looking for both a challenge and some comic relief, you'll find both here.

Now, the following are things I find to be issues, mostly minor and nothing game breaking.

Translation is less than perfect, spelling / grammar / context errors:
I've found a few of these here and there, nothing major and definitely not an issue for most to know what was intended to be said, but they are present nonetheless. (not bad for English not being my first language)

Pots:
Cool, we can smash shit. Be better if they respawned, or if more pots had stuff in them. Actually, about the only cool thing about this is the fact that smashing a pot makes a nice crunchy sound.

Eight Equip/Skill Slots:
That snuck up on me, having to discard a weapon to pick up something new. It definitely limits what one can do, so this actually ramps the difficulty up quite a bit for casual players (I picked the game up and expected a casual style of play).

Running Jokes Everywhere, So have a Steak!
(where does all the steak come from?)
Much less a gripe, than just always being there; always something silly happening at least once on the next screen. Kinda breaks game immersion a little.

Helen Can't Read... -_-
That actually really makes the game harder to get into, because reading everything possible is what helps one to learn about the lore. It isn't until one reaches the town that one learns a tiny bit about the lore.

Castle? What Castle?
Starting off, it's the northern ruins, and then the NPCs discuss things that talk about floors as if the whole thing is the castle, the oddest one I've ever seen then!

Now, onto what makes this game great:
The Battle System...
Okay, it's basic TTB (Timer Turn Battle) stuff, but I don't see too many of those anymore. One can plan ahead and never take damage, or take very little, but then there's always the defense ignoring crap that takes 20-50% HP.

Skill XP
Actually, it's both great and a bit flawed. But the benefits for cost is the main thing; I'd tweak it just a little bit, but overall, it's the best I've seen implemented aside from the one in the Deadly Sin games and Skyborn.

Music
Not much to say here; all the pieces fit together well (some don't properly loop but that could be by design).

Sprinting
It helps in a pinch, definitely. Though, truth be told, one doesn't sprint far before bumping into something. Ah well.

Silly NPCs
As much as it can be annoying (at times), it does keep things light-hearted, and I do believe, yes, that is part of the point.

Graphics
Hey! I love retro gaming! The graphics work just fine for me! The aesthetic is well-achieved here!

Rest Points/Save Anywhere
It's a good thing when you need to heal, and save after a run-in with some strong enemy.

Story
It's one of those (so it seems anyway) piece-it-together-yourself kind of stories, but even though there's not a whole lot of interaction along the way, one does get vague hints from NPCs (as well as game-breaking advice at times), that can help the process along.

Conclusion:
Want a great RPG with both a good story and challenge, that isn't too bonkerballs? Helen's Mysterious Cavern, unnn, Castle awaits! lol

author: {'steamid': '76561197995330526', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1478399731}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041969713', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1535158058}
review:
Small, cute, and charming
The game advertises itself as an "Epic RPG", which while it fits, it has no shortage of funny moments even in serious times. The dialog is very well written, both for funny moments, and when it's really serious. And the music compliments it too.
The game keeps its momentum going, and it might be a bit hard to put down when it starts to really pick up. But it's a short, concise, and well put story that's easy to pick up and play through from start to finish.
Very enjoyable overall!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272406069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1567830395}
review:
Helen's Mysterious Castle is really cute. I got this game on sale, and I'm pretty glad I did, considering it's repetitive nature. However, I feel as though the benefit of having a hit point added to your total health is a good way to make repetitive things helpful. I don't have many problems with this game, except that it's just tiresome to keep dying, waking up, and going to the same place multiple times. 
    Granted, I am no aficionado when it comes to RPG games. But I still feel the ability to move forward would be extremely beneficial! The game has such potential, but it, at the point I am at in the game, is just elongated grinding to no avail.
     I would reccomend this game to those who can withstand the passage of time and the urge to stop playing fpr the fear of seeing the same cut scene over, and over, and over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018488380', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1531634174}
review:
A fun, albeit, short RPGMaker game. While it largely uses the base RPGM graphics, it has a different combat system that requires some tactical thinking; and while it's interesting combat at the start, by late game it starts to get repetitive, though the game isn't long enough for it to get too annoying. The story, while adequate, is nothing special.

Overall, it is quite enjoyable for the few hours it lasts, and is well worth it at the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162368960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1612754117}
review:
Un RPG un tanto extraño. Minimalista en muchos sentidos. Escasos diálogos, no ítems, no monedas, no introducción, no subes niveles, no compañeros, etc. Ni siquiera hay un menú como tal. El gameplay es sorprendentemente bueno para lo poco que parece ofrecer. La estrategia consiste en elegir bien tus armas para cada enemigo, e irlas mejorando a base de farmeo y puntos. Cada batalla es un puzzle en sí mismo.
Es adictivo, y es increíble el jugo que se le puede sacar a las batallas 1 vs 1.

PROS:
*Verdadera estrategia para sobrevivir a los calabozos.
*Variedad de enemigos, cada uno con una estrategia diferente.
*No hay encuentros aleatorios.
*Sistema original que se entiende bastante rápido.
*Adictivo, no cuesta trabajo farmear.
*Veloz en todo sentido, las batallas son muy rápidas.
*Casi no pesa el juego.

CONTRAS:
*Historia vaga, sin mucha importancia, y que sólo toma ligera preponderancia después de la mitad del juego.
*Poca exploración.
*Escaso sidequest.
*Duración relativamente breve.
*Es RPG Maker...


Llévatelo, el precio está gritando "CÓMPRAME".

author: {'steamid': '76561198207632569', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1550234701}

author: {'steamid': '76561198206068576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1531247689}
review:
An unknown, obscure gem of an RPG. Lovely story about choices and decision-making, the dialogues can be completely serious and then absolutely hilarious right next second ! Definitely a must-play, especially if you enjoy exploring without the game taking your hand AT ALL. It's a bit like the first Zelda games, you hit "new game" and then off you go on your adventure, knowing just about as much as your hero knows (which means "nothing", in fact). 
Absolutely loved this game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198020732600', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1558776337}
review:
The graphics may look like standard RPG maker, but the creators have made animations and sprites to match the art style. This makes it a very professional looking game, with nice music and a cute story.

The custom combat system is centered around equipment with different lengths of delay before your next turn comes around. This generally means using shields when the enemy is about to attack, and using weapons to counter when it's safe, but the game's enemies have moves that vary enough that you have to think about what to do every now and then.  I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152117038', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1533266127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198419848681', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1539302246}
review:
Summary: Helen's Mysterious Castle is a 3~6 hour blast of a fighting-adventure.
- The generic RPG-Maker combat-system has been completely scrapped, and replaced with something *really* fun. I found myself fighting every enemy I came across just so I could experience more of it.
- What little story the game has is a rather charming parody of JRPG troupes.
- The soundtrack is very good. Well over two years after finishing the game, I still listen to it.

That's all. No more need be said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132825032', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1571102761}
review:
Well I just beat Helen's Mysterious Castle and all I can say about it, aside from this review, is "Wow" It was SO GOOD!!
And for how cheap and short it is...it has a story that is better than bigger budget games and has quite the interesting game mechanic
The music is also pretty darn good too! The ending is so much fun to play with everything that happens during it~
I highly recomend it, even if you're not good at rpgs. The game is challenging but easy. I don't know how to explain that better aside from that it's all about timing things correctly~

Honestly, I think it should be worth a bit more. Also I think that the devs could make an entire game based around what happens after the ending~ It was just so great to play! Great things do come in small packages!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080278191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1645037495}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077422172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1527008906}
review:
Made me very satisfied and has interesting mechanics.

The main strength of the game is, in my opinion, the battle system. It's certainly well thought out and makes even random encounters interesting. It's both very simple and deep. Each weapon/magic has damage, defense and wait values, which determines how it's going to interact with the enemy's own attack, which has its own damage, defense and wait value. Making it so you will need to think well of what to use against each kind of enemy. Some enemies are also "smarter" than others, and will exploit the openings of your attacks. Having enemies behaving differently depending on your actions really adds some spice to the game and I wished other games would do the same. Most bosses are also pretty interesting, having an unique moveset or strategy that makes their fights feel special (though only a handful of them are actually challenging). The level design is also very praise worthy. There's plenty of secrets and I saw myself looking around every corner when I encountered a new area.

Now the main shortcoming of the game is the story, I think. Everything feels kind of barebones, as if just to say there's a story, and keeps changing in tone through most of the game (suddenly the intense encounter becomes a comedic moment... for the 3rd time). It becomes sort of interesting once it picks up, though, with lot of "climax" moments by the ending (I quite enjoyed the ending at least).

The visuals are consistent enough. I really liked the combat sprites myself. The sound also never gets in the way of the game and fits nicely (nothing turns me off more than a repetitive and annoying battle music).

The game isn't particularly long, but it's actually longer than you'd expect from the price range. Meanwhile I left plenty satisfied and made me feel like playing it again some other time (I'd also be really interested in more games with a similar battle system).

author: {'steamid': '76561198081145965', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1530550948}

author: {'steamid': '76561198153970899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1594874173}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000903121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1527044026}
review:
Nope.
I kind of want to leave it at that but I won't.
The gameplay loop isn't bad... until it becomes bad...
I can't find a map anywhere online, it looks like no-one has bothered to make one.  That's where this game falls apart.  Go through a door? Every monster respawns.  Make a wrong turn, that's a bunch of 1 shot battles again.  The battles are easy but the maps are absolutely ridiculous.
I had fun with this game until I couldn't navigate the maps anymore.  That is my main complaint.
There are other things like no way to adjust the settings.  I dug through the game folder to find a way to open the game full screen.  I'm fortunate my game controller just worked right away.  But after enough time of circling back and running in circles without a map I said that's it I'm out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009798179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1526898340}
review:
A realy cool short RPG experience that I enjoyed very much. For the price tag, it's ridiculously good if you're into oldschool RPG but with modern twist.

Qualities:
[list]
    [*]Fast and smart combat system. It's intuitive and innovative.
    [*]No random battle. Enemies are visible and you can avoid them. 
    [*]Engaging level design with an interconnected world that reminds me of Dar* ****
    [*]Story and world that are always exciting to discover.
    [*]The undead knight.
    [*]Lots of elegant and simple design choices that really fits the small scope of the game (xp, fast run, death bonus, items and inventory management, etc.) 
[/list]
Flaws:
[list]
    [*]Sometime you'll wonder what to do next and discover you had to go through a kinda random wall to progress. Happened to me thrice but was always easily solved with the Forum and Youtube.
    [*]The writtings is changing, sometimes it's Undertale good, sometimes it's FF3 cheezy.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198176030879', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1558720324}
review:
这是一部让人玩着从心底感到高兴的作品，像童年时代的小小冒险，会紧张会好奇，会兴奋会气馁，可从不真正感到害怕，因为回头就是爱你的家与人。
游戏体验很好，一口气通关，战斗系统朴素不失趣味性，剧情说不上特别却充满着温馨感[strike]以及大写的可爱[/strike]，天也蓝草也绿花也香，连风都唱着歌，我就是全天下最受关爱的小小勇者！
——大抵会有这种感想。
无论是作为海伦感受到家人友人的爱，还是作为玩家感受到作者的爱，这部作品都做到了。

非常喜欢奔跑中的海伦，一往无前，似乎下一秒就能离地而飞。
[spoiler]虽说一跑起来我老把握不准方向，多走一格少走一格常有的事[/spoiler]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1387196757
把游戏音乐文件夹里几首喜欢的mid曲子转成了mp3，画风突变，挺好听的

author: {'steamid': '76561198353687450', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1507083551}
review: 很有趣的一款游戏，战斗模式别出心裁，值得一玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198009922047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1524523800}
review: This game feels like a shorter, simpler, MUCH less trollish Undertale. The story has interesting twists, some cute humour and I like all the characters. I LOVE the music. The battle system is unusual for an RPG and fun, it almost entirely revolves around you calculating how many turns a move will take. Later you really have to predict what an enemy will do next in order to win, it can be a challenge as there's limited ways in which you can get anywhere purely by grinding. For a short, inexpensive RPG with a good plot that isn't just a cookie cutter RPG maker game, I would recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001905338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1712088699}
review: Wow, this is really good!  Easily at the level of a great game boy advance RPG.  The worst part is the beginning when you think there's not going to be any plot, and just gameplay.  Fortunately the gameplay is engaging, and the plot is light hearted and interesting enough.  If you're an RPG fan, this is a steal of a game at this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370313472', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1523247595}
review: The repetitive nature of this game bugged me at first. But once I got farther into the game it becomes a lot harder, where strategy and loadout become big factors. Once you know what to use and when the game becomes very easy. One of the most frustrating things about this game is getting lost and having to find hidden passages I honestly almost quit twice because I could not find some areas. The game is pretty good if you can handle repetitive gameplay trying to beat bosses multiple times and backtracking a lot. The story is pretty cool and certainly not what I expected. Just when you think the game is over it keeps throwing more content at. I thought the game was worth my time for the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320207230', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1520679912}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077147190', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1520414111}
review:
----Bitte nicht wegen meiner Spielzeit wundern. Ich habs offline gespielt.----

Helen's Mysterious Castle spielte sich etwas anders, als ich erwartet habe. Hinter der niedlichen Fassade verbirgt sich ein kleines, kampflastiges Rollenspiel. Die Kämpfe machen Laune, sie sind aber auch oft ziemlich knackig. An dieser Stelle ein kleiner Tipp: Man kann seine Waffen im Inventar durch Erfahrungspunkte verbessern, später auch beim Schmied.

Das Kampfystem basiert auf Aktionspunkten. Ein Schlag mit dem Breitschwert benötigt z.B. 14 "Züge", ein Schuss mit dem Langbogen nur 5. Dafür haut das Breitschwert viel stärker rein und bringt starke defensive Boni. Ein Zauber macht am meisten Schaden, dafür dauert es ewig, bis er ausgeführt ist und man hat währenddessen keinerlei Verteidigung. Das ganze wirkt dann wie ein kleines Schachspiel, denn der Gegner kontert die eigenen Züge. Man wirkt zu Beginn einen Zauber? Dann greift er eben mit seinem Schwert an und verursacht jedes mal vollen Schaden, weil man ja keinerlei Verteidigung hat. Also nutzt man z.B. am Anfang einen Bogen, damit der Gegner den Schild rausholt und wirkt dann einen Zauber, der die Verteidigung durchdringt. => Da der Bogen weniger Aktionspunkte verbraucht, als der Schild des Gegners, hält er also noch ein Weilchen den Schild hoch, während man in Ruhe zaubern kann. So hat man einen kleinen Vorteil.

Da das Spiel sehr kampflastig ist, hält es sich nicht sehr mit der Erzählung einer Story auf. Klar, es gibt sie und sie ist auch nicht schlecht, aber sie tritt bei dem Spiel doch in den Hintergrund. Zur Story selbst möchte ich nichts sagen, da ich nicht spoilern will.

Um im Spiel voranzukommen, ist es manchmal notwendig, kleinere Rätsel zu lösen oder verborgene Pfade (in Wänden o.ä.) zu finden. An einer Stelle artete es leider ziemlich aus, den Pfad zu finden.

In ca. 6-7 Stunden hat man dann jedenfalls alle Kämpfe bestritten, alle verborgenen Pfade entdeckt und kann sich im Abspann darüber Gedanken machen, was für ein wunderbares, kleines Spiel Helen's Mysterious Castle doch ist. Denn es spielt sich sehr kurzweilig und wunderbar anders, als die Stardard-RPG-Maker-Spiele. Und es ist definitiv seine 2 € wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111110671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1523234911}
review:
Very likeable and fun short RPG. 
It makes very nice use of the RPG Maker resources. 
The combat system is intuitive and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054200480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1266, 'last_played': 1540694583}
review:
Adorable RPG. This has a combat system that's based on simple math. This game has gotten me to beat it twice thus far. The characters are cheezy in the orginal star wars trilogy way, and the protagonist looks really cool as the wind is constantly blowing her hair (even indoors and in caves!). 

Overall recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263115544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1500778215}
review: Really, really good. My long hours on record are from multiple playthroughs. (not in succession, but it was a fun enough game to come back to after time).

author: {'steamid': '76561197995202158', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1520198315}
review: Helen is mute and illiterate but very good with swords.  A simple but very pure dungeon rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971471023', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1615258299}
review: I honestly didn't know what to expect when I got this game, it was cheap, and the sprites looked nice, so I figured eh, why not. This game is a challenge! if you know how to work it's battle system, you will be able to beat anything, just make sure you are leveling up your gear, and find the weapons that suit you best. My only issue is that the level design can get a bit confusing, I have been wandering around the same level for a while now because it all looks the same to me. Overall though, the combat system (to me) is where this game really shines, and I think for the price, this game was totally worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998498191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1519348779}
review:
This is an interesting little RPG, with a unique, and quite interesting, combat system. The whole game is quite short, five and a half hours, and that's considering I tend to wander off and explore in an RPG. Music is good, but spotted a few things in the translation (weird symbols, minor quality issues).

For two dollars, you're getting more than your money's worth in terms of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286411323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1711761995}
review:
クリアしました。結構ゆっくりじっくりプレイしたので8時間近く遊びましたが、素直にプレイすればもっと短いですね。
戦闘システムが新鮮です。後々を考えて、相手の行動を見ながら自分のHPと相談してかかる時間を計算して・・・と多少考える必要があり、それがとても楽しかった。
ゲームバランスも最高。細かい配慮もあり、ちょうどいい難易度です。

同じシステムで、他のゲームができたら買いたいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030888821', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1538158405}

But It's worth 2$.

Would you recommend this game? (? / !)
Answer: !

author: {'steamid': '76561198137924743', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1519048605}
review:
简单而精致的小作品，末尾的剧情演出也丝毫不差
怪物的大家都是好朋友的设定让我有点想起《传说之下》，但是观感上这部要好多了，果然我还是喜欢日式内核吧……

author: {'steamid': '76561198040828497', 'num_games_owned': 6423, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1514286599}
review:
Battles are really fun for an RPG of this style. (I don't have much experience with them to begin with) You sometimes get that feeling of completely outplaying your enemies. It's long enough for its price, and short enough to not feel like a chore. You run pretty darn quickly which is awesome for getting right back into the action and not having death be an extremely boring affair.

Writing leans on the good side, is concise, and compliments the game well, but probably wouldn't hold on its own.

Music doesn't do anything special, but is all around stellar and awesome.

Overall a really good package for an ultra budget price.

Only big issue is how you might get stuck not knowing what to do next, but is usually good about helping you enough while not hand holding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121180990', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1563307622}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010871335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1518161030}
review: Elegant, intelligent an fun game. A rpg maker masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027880845', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1516200893}
review:
Most of the time it's true, you get what you pay for.

In this case of Helen's Mysterious Castle you certainly get your $2 worth. It has a unique battle system that is fun at the start but by the end of this short game you'll have your fill. The same goes for the paper thin story that falls flat by the end. I still found the game enjoyable but by the end I was just pushing to get the ending. 

Some other issues I had were the sloppy controls and the at times grating sound effects.

I'd rate this a [b]C[/b]. All in all this is a $2 game and if you want a new experience for cheap you can do a lot worse here on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198338352116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1517293894}
review:
这是一款几乎完美的游戏，剧情优秀，玩法独特，地图设计巧妙，难度亲民，BGM根本听不厌。
当我折服（艹翻）第二阶层BOSS，抄起炎剑，将要开启新世界大门时，游戏崩溃的那一刻（居然还是个BUG），我意识到，游戏体验过好导致的易忘记存档无疑就是她的缺点。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100865226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1560069214}
review:
The battle system was certainly unique and interesting. Quite the breathe of fresh air compared to the usual turn based RPG combat. It felt incredibly fair, and really has you think beyond just spamming the strongest move.

The narrative was slow at first, but when it began to pick up, I couldn't tear my eyes away from it.

That said, I so sometimes wish it's easier to know where we're supposed to go to advance the story. I've found myself lost at certain points due to how massive the dungeons become, and the backtracking that results from it just kills the atmosphere. There's also the issue with the Silent Demon Lord. More hints on what to do on his section would have been immensely helpful in reducing the frustration that came from him.

Still, it was a enjoyable experience all in all. Certainly a cut above the usual RPG.
